item.title: Bandai Namco Is Shutting Down Another Pac-Man Battle Royale Game On Switch
item.content:encoded:
It was released last year

Following the release of Pac-Man Mega Tunnel Battle: Chomp Champs on the Switch eShop in May 2024, Bandai Namco has now announced it will be shutting down the latest battle royale entry.

In an announcement on social media this week, the company revealed sales of the title would end this November. Gameplay services will then end on 31st December 2025 and the game will no longer be playable after this date. Here it is in full:

Bandai Namco: "PAC-MAN Mega Tunnel Battle: Chomp Champs update - Weâ€™d like to share an important update regarding PAC-MAN Mega Tunnel Battle: Chomp Champs. Product sales will end on 1 November 2025. Gameplay services will end on 31 December 2025, and the game will no longer be playable."

When this paid title was originally released, we gave it five out of ten stars and raised concerns at the time about how long it would remain active. This follows the shutdown of the Nintendo Switch Online exclusive PAC-MAN 99 in October 2023.

What are your thoughts about this announcement? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.
